alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 9:25PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Ada, southern Payette, Canyon, northwestern Owyhee, southwestern Gem and east central Malheur Counties through 1015 PM MDT... At 925 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eagle to near Star to Huston to near Rockville. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Greenleaf, Homedale, Notus and Huston around 930 PM MDT. Parma, Wilder, Succor Creek Campground and Letha around 940 PM MDT. New Plymouth, Nyssa, Owyhee and Adrian around 950 PM MDT. Owyhee Dam around 1000 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley
